result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor M Lysaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: On each count concurrent with same conditions also concurrent.

miscConds.notes:
Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Credit for 22 days if probation revoked.
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor M Lysaker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revoked sentenced to CJ

2:32 PM - Def in court w/ Atty Michael Yang.  Def in custody.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HYNEK; ask to deviate upward.  He was going to get into trmt and was going to do well. Had lots of bond problems but gave him the bene of the doubt and reduced them to mis. He continues to use, doesn't work as he's supposed to and goes w/ his girlfriend during the time she commits crimes. YANG: He has had problems w/ probation. He will be going to a Milwaukee trmt cntr. Ask you to follow the recommended sentence. DEF: I want to prove to my parents that I can become something. CRT: you havent done anything to show you are committed. If you don't get this under control you will be heading to prison shortly. You used probation to get out of jail and con't the lifestyle that lead to these convictions. Probation was for rehabilitation but you chose not to follow thru w/ the promises you made at sentencing. 
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
SENTENCE:
Ct. 1 & 2 - def sentenced to 30 days CJ w/ credit for  151 days
Ct. 3 - def sentenced to 5 mos  CJ w/ credit for 151 days. All sentences are concurrent
financials are converted to a civil judgment
from PO Dayna Albitz   re: Sentencing after Revocation / Revocation summary attached
Michael Yang

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
email to SLH from Cindy C., Br 1  re: Msg rec'd from jail that def was picked up on JSS Capias that you issued.  This is a closed case - do you want me to put on calendar some time?
Per SLH:  no need to set a Hrg unless PO or def asks for it.  He is simply to serve the remainder of his sentence in jaul w/o release
arrested by LCSO

signed SLH
Visions 01/02/2015 KP
DOC paperwork

11:35 AM - Def in court w/ Atty William P. Flottmeyer.  Def in custody.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PO present
Vasupuram: PO has been generous w/ the def. Surprised he's not being revoked. He's young and is stuggeling w/ sub abuse. He's not doing well at all since being placed on probation and he con't to use, absconded, hasn't been honest w/ her. Asking for more than 30 days. 18 days credit.
Flottmeyer: He was in custody on his 20th birthday. He's committing crimes but he's not violent. He's got it as bad as I've seen. I asked PO why he's not getting revoked and she said she wanted to give him a shot. After 3-4 wks he's clean and sober and after that, I don't know. I defer to the agent and she says 30 days. She's putting in the effort which I appreciate and I hope he does too. If they wanted to they could refer him for charges and he could sit for 18-24 mos. 
Def: I messed up. I work every day. I love my family but don't know why I keep doing this. I am a drug addict and I can't keep hurting my family.
Crt: having a hard time looking at the pattern and seeing much of an effort to put yourself in a position to running an office but rather just being another inmate in the prison system. when I read the violation report I was surprised that the DOC wasn't seeking rev. That says PO sees potential in you and she's trying to do what she can to give you the chance to succeed. 
DEF TO SERVE 30 days w/o release w/ credit for 18 days and then def to serve 30 days EM. EM is NOT house arrest and wil allow PO to establish the curfew. It's rehabilitative and not punitive so if probation is revoked you will not get credit for that 30 days. 
It is not my practice to allow time on EM if you get revoked. Someone cuts off the EM device and come back for sentencing, I am not simply going to restore that, you can expect sentence to be served w/o release
Amended

Def w/atty Flottmeyer
  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
  Statement as to Neg. Plea filed
Ltr from Driftless Recovery Service
Ct1,2,3: Def pleads guily
CRT: sentence withheld 1 year probation on each count concurrent w/same cond also concurrent w/cond: continue w/AODA trmt, any other assess deemed approp by PO & comply, pay CC + DOC SUpervision fees, credit for 22 days if probation revoked, expungement if probation completed successfully
assigned PO Dayna Albitz

10:00 AM - No appearance by Def - Atty William P. Flottmeyer present.  Michelle Ann Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Flottmeyer: he's now out on JS program and in intensive out pt counseling and is doing really well. State wants a little more time to see how well he will do  to see if they accept/decline my counter offer. It's still on for trial 
Crt: leave on trial cal.

P, w/Atty, Ct modified bond - $2500 sig bond - comply w/treatment plan as outlined by Driftless Recovery, comply w/JS monitoring, 10pm-6am curfew to be enforced thru EM, sign releases so JS can monitor compliance w/trtmt conditions plus other conditions on prior bond remain.

From: Driftless Recovery Services Re: services offered
SLH: cc to attys
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

JS VIOLATIONS
Def w/Atty Flottmeyer
OTD issued
CRT: order $500 bond forfeited - substitute $2500 cash bond - if not posted immediately will be remanded to custody of sheriff - will reconsider bond once there is a trmt plan in place & there are provisions in place for monitoring his compliance w/trmt - if is inpatiend trmt will modify bond to allow him to attend that inpatient trmt - if outpatient I want to make sure there are provisions in place to monitor testing & compliance w/trmt plan that's outlined. What we have in place isn't working. can set hearing when trmt plan in place & show ltrs from trmt facility what the plan is - JS will have to have signed release of info so they can talk to the trmt providers - then I will reconsider the bond
Taken into custody
Wililam Flottmeyer

signed SLH
Visions 07/03/2014 KP

2:58 pm -  Def in court w/Atty Patricia L O'Neil.  Julie Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
O'Neil: he will go to the county for funding or check on ins thru parents. 
Nelson: this is a serious case and he had track marks on his arm. No doubt there is a use issue - defer to the court
Crt: people are dying in this community from heroin use and I won't stand by and sit back and watch you con't to use. Any other instances of use there will be an OTD issued, unless you disclose the use to JS b/f it's discovered
BOND MODIFIED:  def is to have a treatment appointment set up by 5/13/14 by the end of the day and report to JS immediately after court and sign releases so they can monitor participation in treatment. Def is required to test immediately after court
